definition:
A function $h : \mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}$ is said to be a *Hamel
function* if $h$, considered as a subset
$\{(x,h(x)\}\subset \mathbb{R}^{n+1}$, is a Hamel basis for
$\mathbb{R}^{n+1}$ over $\mathbb{Q}$. We denote the set of
$n$-dimensional Hamel function by $HF(\mathbb{R}^n)$.

[**References**]{}

-   Poltka, K. *On Functions Whose Graph is a Hamel Basis*. Unpublised
    Ph.D. work. Online at
    <http://academic.scranton.edu/faculty/PLOTKAK2/publications/ham_0911.pdf>
